job_title:
We are currently seeking a Software Developer - C/C++ for a client located in Mississauga. This is a full-time, permanent position with salary and benefits. We are ideally looking for self starters with experience ramping up products.

Development Skills

Experience in developing real time software using C++ on Linux platform
Design and develop C++ Microservices for use in distributed systems; Experience with RESTful API development
Experience installing, configuring, administering, monitoring, and troubleshooting message brokers, ESB such as RabbitMQ , Kafka, MuleSoft etc
Experience working with cloud and containerization technologies including AWS, Google Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes etc.
Improve quality of existing code base through debugging, re-factoring and improving unit and system tests
Ability to work in fast-paced environment with Agile mindset; Experience working with Scrum APM practices and tools including Jira, Confluence, Git etc.

Networking Skills

Understanding of Core Network protocols
Experience in developing or integrating with real-time systems for networking products
Experience in developing with Software Defined Network Elements is an asset
Understanding of Network protocols and access (MPLS, OpenBGP, OpenFlow) is an asset
Understanding of networking principals and concepts (SDN-WAN, SDN, labelling, routing etc.) is an asset
Understanding of 3GPP/5G network management, including Radio configuration, QoS management, SLA management, Netconf, SNMP, directives is an asset

Soft Skills

Team player
Communication – to work with a diverse & global team
Excited to make a difference by working in a startup environment – minimal supervision, out of box thinker
Interested in becoming a key contributor, at the foundational stage of a start-up’s journey

Why Work With Us?

Dynamic new technology

Convenient location

Great growth opportunity

Powered by JazzHR

job_description:
Location: Canada, remote

Work experience: 3-5 years’ experience

Seniority Level: Mid level

Employment Type: Full-time

We Are

Voiant is a global consulting company. We act as value creators and business operators in everything that we work in the service of our clients – large and small. We identify improvement opportunities unique to their business and provide the expertise required to make digital transformations happen.

We are hiring Senior Full-Stack Web Developer with Mapbox or Geospatial experience to join our North America team.

This is a remote position; you may reside and work from anywhere in Canada or the United States.

Voiant offers our clients guidance, know-how, and expertise. We bring functional insights, data power, and the digital tech leadership to help our clients navigate a digital journey. Whether we are breaking down meaningful analytics, designing enablement platforms, or building new operating models to be ready for the future, we solve our client's toughest problems.

You Are
A true consultant – with an entrepreneurial and problem-solver approach, you have great ability to diagnose a client’s unique needs and design solutions to get them there.
A great project & team leader – you lead onshore and offshore teams, supporting them through all project phases while making sure the client is satisfied and the project is running smoothly.
A great communicator and demonstrates ability to develop long lasting professional relationships, by always having your client’s interest in mind & team’s needs.
Technical, resourceful with a business-oriented mindset – you have in-depth knowledge of enterprise systems, data, networking modules, software integration, and familiarity with programming languages. You have ability to see big-picture designs from basic specifications and to solve complex IT issues.
The Work

You'll help clients define their requirements by leading and facilitating working sessions to understand the client's current state processes and technology in the geospatial space and supporting the implementation that follows.

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer with Mapbox or Geospatial experience who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming, transitioning seamlessly between front and backend coding.
Lead project discovery workshops, both on-site and remotely
Fluent in creating fully-fledged data-driven platforms (with databases, servers, and clients) that thrive on strong architecture.
Optimize application functionality throughout the lifecycle of each project.
Expert in Node.js, frontend/backend frameworks, and databases.
The power of our application responsiveness and functionality will be in your hands, so you'll approach software holistically since you will cater to both user experience and functionality, organized, communicative, and detail-oriented to ensure it works on every intended platform-so which means you'll have to be strong in coding for mobile, too.
Here’s What You Need
Minimum 5 years of full-stack web development experience
Minimum 1 year of experience with geospatial platforms (Mapbox, Google Maps, OpenStreetMaps)
Experience with AWS services (Lambda, S3, Cloudwatch)
Experience with relational and non-relational databases
Ability to program in languages such as Typescript/Javascript, Python, Java
Knowledge of Component-Based JavaScript frameworks (React/Redux)
Strong Front End Skills (Responsive Designs, HTML, CSS)
Ability to clearly articulate and explain technical concepts and design decisions to internal and external stakeholders
Helping grow the engineering team by participating in the interview process
Strong competence in writing, updating, and using documentation
Embrace a collaborative team environment where team members can operate with autonomy
Experience with test automation frameworks and test-driven environment
Excellent communication & story telling abilities
Bonus Points If
You have experience working in fast-paced startup environments
You have experience building DevOps pipelines, Docker/Kubernetes, and Application Monitoring
You have used Jira, Confluence, Nx, and Npx
You have an advanced degree in a STEM field
JOB CODE: 1000007
